attributes.action: Form a cross party government to tackle Coronavirus and open a public inquiry
attributes.additional_details:
As a nation there is one glaring issue facing us all. We do not need political point scoring at the moment. The current government has adopted a highly questionable strategy from the outset. 

With each day that passes the current government strategy seems to be even more questionable. Dissolve the current government and form a cross party government to tackle this crisis and launch an immediate public inquiry into the actions undertaken by this government to tackle Coronavirus in the UK.
attributes.background:
This is not a time for party political differences. The UK public deserves a coherent and united parliamentary response to Coronavirus. 

The evolution of Coronavirus in the UK is a public health emergency. We need a public inquiry to examine the current government's questionable strategy.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions calling for the same action: 

Emergency National Unity Government: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301563

Hold a Public Inquiry into the handling of the Covid-19 crisis: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302576

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
